summary: MY WIFE WAS DRIVING SOUTH OF KANSAS CITY ON MO HIGHWAY 71.  SHE WAS PASSING A CAR ON THE LEFT LANE OF A DIVIDED HIGHWAY AND THE RIGHT FRONT TIRE "EXPLODED, IMMEDIATELY PULLING HER OFF THE ROAD DOWN A 3-4 FT. EMBANKMENT INTO THE MEDIAN.  LUCKILY, SHE AVOIDED ROLLING THE TRUCK AND WAS NOT PERSONALLY INJURED.  THE TIRE HAS SEPERATED BELTS AND LOOKS LIKE IT "EXPLODED".  THE TIRE IS A FIRESTONE STEELTEX A/T LT 265/75 R16 DOT VNW8 1XL 289.  IT IS NOT LISTED IN THE FIRESTONE RECALL.  THE TRUCK BUMPER, FENDER AND WHEEL WELL WAS DAMAGED.
